http.400: Request failed. Please check if the request parameters are correct. If you have changed the model settings, please reset them to the default settings
http.401: Authentication failed. Please check if your API key is correct
http.403: Access denied. Please check if your account is verified, or contact the service provider for more information

http.502: Gateway error. Please try again later
http.503: Service unavailable. Please try again later
http.504: Gateway timeout. Please try again later

importFrom.dxtHelp: Select a .dxt file containing an MCP server package
importFrom.invalid: Invalid input, please check JSON format
importFrom.oneServer: Only one MCP server configuration at a time
importFrom.tooltip:
Please copy the configuration JSON (prioritizing
 NPX or UVX configurations) from the MCP Servers introduction page and paste it into the input box.

mcp.argsTooltip: Each argument on a new line

builtinServersDescriptions.brave_search: An MCP server implementation integrating the Brave Search API, providing both web and local search functionalities. Requires configuring the BRAVE_API_KEY environment variable
builtinServersDescriptions.dify_knowledge: Dify's MCP server implementation provides a simple API to interact with Dify. Requires configuring the Dify Key
builtinServersDescriptions.fetch: MCP server for retrieving URL web content
builtinServersDescriptions.filesystem: A Node.js server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for file system operations. Requires configuration of directories allowed for access.
builtinServersDescriptions.memory: Persistent memory implementation based on a local knowledge graph. This enables the model to remember user-related information across different conversations. Requires configuring the MEMORY_FILE_PATH environment variable.
builtinServersDescriptions.python: Execute Python code in a secure sandbox environment. Run Python with Pyodide, supporting most standard libraries and scientific computing packages
builtinServersDescriptions.sequentialthinking: A MCP server implementation that provides tools for dynamic and reflective problem solving through structured thinking processes

websearch.blacklist_description: Results from the following websites will not appear in search results
websearch.blacklist_tooltip:
Please use the following format (separated by newlines)
Pattern matching: *://*.example.com/*
Regular expression: /example\.(net|org)/

limit.label: Cutoff Limit
limit.tooltip: Limit the content length of search results, content exceeding the limit will be truncated (e.g., 2000 characters)

document_count.label: Document Chunks Count
document_count.tooltip: Expected number of document chunks to extract from each search result, the actual total number of extracted document chunks is this value multiplied by the number of search results.

websearch.content_limit_tooltip: Limit the content length of the search results; content that exceeds the limit will be truncated.

websearch.overwrite_tooltip: Force use search service instead of LLM

search_max_result.label: Number of search results
